tatami.core.agent.kb

Interface KnowledgeBase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleKB

    public interface KnowledgeBase
    Interface for the various type of classes that implement an agent's knowledge base.

    It contains the KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription, which the knowledge base can read.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription
      Implementing classes can describe pieces of knowledge, in a format that can be converted to a text representation that can be read by a KnowledgeBase -implementing class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription piece)
      Integrates a piece of knowledge in the knowledge base.
      boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription> piece)
      Integrates several pieces of knowledge in the knowledge base.
      java.util.Collection<KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription> getAll(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
      Retrieves all (order guarantees depend on implementation) pieces of knowledge that match the given pattern.
      KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription getFirst(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
      Retrieves the first (order guarantees depend on implementation) piece of knowledge that matches the given pattern.
      boolean remove(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
      Removes the first (order guarantees depend on implementation) piece of knowledge that matches the given pattern.
      boolean removeAll(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
      Removes all pieces of knowledge that match the given pattern.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription piece)
        Integrates a piece of knowledge in the knowledge base. How exactly that is done depends on the particular implementation of the knowledge base.
        Parameters:
        piece - the description of the piece of knowledge to add.
        Returns:
        true if the knowledge base has been modified (as in Collection classes); false otherwise.

      • addAll

        boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription> piece)
        Integrates several pieces of knowledge in the knowledge base. How exactly that is done depends on the particular implementation of the knowledge base.
        Parameters:
        piece - a Collection of descriptions of the pieces of knowledge to add. The signature is meant to be the same as the signature in Collection.addAll.
        Returns:
        true if the knowledge base has been modified (as in Collection classes); false otherwise.

      • getFirst

        KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription getFirst(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
        Retrieves the first (order guarantees depend on implementation) piece of knowledge that matches the given pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern, as it may be interpreted by the knowledge base.
        Returns:
        a piece of knowledge that matches the pattern. The return may or may not be the same at subsequent calls with the same pattern.

      • getAll

        java.util.Collection<KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription> getAll(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
        Retrieves all (order guarantees depend on implementation) pieces of knowledge that match the given pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern, as it may be interpreted by the knowledge base.
        Returns:
        a collection of pieces of knowledge that match the pattern.

      • remove

        boolean remove(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
        Removes the first (order guarantees depend on implementation) piece of knowledge that matches the given pattern.

        In case the KnowledgeBase implementation does not match the same piece of knowledge at subsequent calls with the same pattern, a remove following a get (with the same pattern) may not remove the same piece of knowledge as it has been found by get. Beware!

        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern, as it may be interpreted by the knowledge base.
        Returns:
        true if the knowledge base has been modified (i.e. a match was found); false otherwise.

      • removeAll

        boolean removeAll(KnowledgeBase.KnowledgeDescription pattern)
        Removes all pieces of knowledge that match the given pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern, as it may be interpreted by the knowledge base.
        Returns:
        true if the knowledge base has been modified (i.e. at least one match was found); false otherwise.
